title.rendered: Explore Job Roles: Computer User Support Specialists

content.rendered:
What is a Computer User Support Specialist?

Computer User Support Specialists are individuals who provide help to employees troubleshoot and solve computer issues.

Where does a Computer User Support Specialist work?

  • Telecommunications
  • Healthcare
  • IT help desks

How much does a Computer User Support Specialist make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a computer user support specialist is $43,403.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Computer User Support Specialists?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing Computer User Support Specialist Jobs.

  • Computer science majors
  • Software engineering majors
Explore Computer Support Specialist job opportunities on Handshake.

Computer User Support Specialists skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Computer User Support Specialist succeed in their work:

  • Strong customer service skills
  • Knowledge of programming languages

What are some common questions about Computer User Support Specialists?

Q: What skills do I need as a computer user support specialist?

A: Some great skills to have under your belt are Outlook, Microsoft Excel, and general diagnostic knowledge and troubleshooting.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Computer User Support Specialist.
